name: Snorlax
explanation: Snorlax is a Normal-type Pokémon known for sleeping and blocking paths.

name: Celebi
explanation: Celebi is a Psychic/Grass-type mythical Pokémon that can travel through time.

name: Geodude
explanation: Geodude is a Rock/Ground-type Pokémon that looks like a boulder with arms.

name: Eevee
explanation: Eevee is a Normal-type Pokémon famous for its many possible evolutions.

name: Pikachu
explanation: Pikachu is the iconic Electric-type Pokémon and mascot of the franchise.

name: Mewtwo
explanation: Mewtwo is a Psychic-type legendary Pokémon created through genetic engineering from Mew's DNA.

name: Ditto
explanation: Ditto is a Normal-type Pokémon that can transform into anything, and also a clipboard manager app for macOS.

name: Porygon
explanation: Porygon is the first artificial Pokémon, made entirely of programming code - a digital construct.

name: Chansey
explanation: Chansey is a Normal-type Pokémon that carries a healing egg in its pouch.

name: Blissey
explanation: Blissey is Chansey's evolution, known for its nurturing nature and high HP.

name: Drowzee
explanation: Drowzee is a Psychic-type Pokémon that feeds on dreams.

name: Hypno
explanation: Hypno is Drowzee's evolution, carrying a pendulum it uses to hypnotize prey.

name: Electrode
explanation: Electrode is an Electric-type Pokémon that resembles a Poké Ball and is known for exploding.

name: Magneton
explanation: Magneton is an Electric/Steel-type Pokémon composed of three Magnemite linked together.

name: Rotom
explanation: Rotom is an Electric/Ghost-type Pokémon that can possess electrical appliances.

name: Arceus
explanation: Arceus is the mythical 'God Pokémon' said to have created the Pokémon universe.

name: Dialga
explanation: Dialga is a Steel/Dragon-type legendary Pokémon that controls time.

name: Palkia
explanation: Palkia is a Water/Dragon-type legendary Pokémon that controls space.

name: Giratina
explanation: Giratina is a Ghost/Dragon-type legendary Pokémon that rules the Distortion World.

name: Luxray
explanation: Luxray is an Electric-type Pokémon with eyes that can see through anything.

name: Lucario
explanation: Lucario is a Fighting/Steel-type Pokémon that can sense and manipulate aura.

name: Audino
explanation: Audino is a Normal-type Pokémon that can sense feelings through its ear feelers.

name: Latios
explanation: Latios is a Dragon/Psychic-type legendary Pokémon known for high intelligence.

name: Latias
explanation: Latias is a Dragon/Psychic-type legendary Pokémon and Latios's counterpart.

name: Slowpoke
explanation: Slowpoke is a Water/Psychic-type Pokémon known for its slow reactions.

name: Abra
explanation: Abra is a Psychic-type Pokémon that sleeps 18 hours a day and teleports when threatened.

name: Kadabra
explanation: Kadabra is Abra's evolution, a Psychic-type that emits alpha waves from its body.

name: Alakazam
explanation: Alakazam is Kadabra's evolution with an IQ of 5,000 and powerful psychic abilities.

name: Nidoran
explanation: Nidoran is a Poison-type Pokémon that was the first to have distinct male and female forms.

name: Gengar
explanation: Gengar is a Ghost/Poison-type Pokémon that hides in shadows to steal heat from surroundings.

name: Arcanine
explanation: Arcanine is a Fire-type Pokémon known for its speed, loyalty, and majestic appearance.

name: Gastly
explanation: Gastly is a Ghost/Poison-type Pokémon composed almost entirely of gas.

name: Koffing
explanation: Koffing is a Poison-type Pokémon that stores toxic gases in its body.

name: Weezing
explanation: Weezing is Koffing's evolution, consisting of two Koffing fused together.

name: Tangela
explanation: Tangela is a Grass-type Pokémon whose body is covered in thick blue vines.

name: Nidoking
explanation: Nidoking is the final evolution of male Nidoran, a powerful Poison/Ground-type.

name: Starmie
explanation: Starmie is a Water/Psychic-type starfish Pokémon with a glowing jewel core.

name: Dratini
explanation: Dratini is a Dragon-type Pokémon that was long considered a mythical creature.

name: Dragonite
explanation: Dragonite is Dratini's final evolution, a Dragon/Flying-type known for rescuing people at sea.

name: Skorupi
explanation: Skorupi is a Poison/Bug-type Pokémon that looks like a scorpion.

name: Klefki
explanation: Klefki is a Steel/Fairy-type Pokémon that collects keys on its ring-shaped body.

name: Xerneas
explanation: Xerneas is the Fairy-type legendary Pokémon representing life in Pokémon X.

name: Pixilate
explanation: Pixilate is a Pokémon ability that turns Normal-type moves into Fairy-type moves.

name: Axew
explanation: Axew is a Dragon-type Pokémon with tusks that it uses to crush berries and mark territory.

name: Dio
explanation: DIO is the iconic main villain of JoJo's Bizarre Adventure, named after Ronnie James Dio, the heavy metal legend.

name: Metallica
explanation: Metallica is Risotto Nero's iron-manipulating Stand in JoJo Part 5, named after the legendary thrash metal band.

name: Aerosmith
explanation: Aerosmith is Narancia's miniature plane Stand in JoJo Part 5, named after the American rock band.

name: Red Hot Chili Pepper
explanation: Red Hot Chili Pepper is Akira Otoishi's electric Stand in JoJo Part 4, named after the funk rock band.

name: Purple Haze
explanation: Purple Haze is Fugo's deadly virus Stand in JoJo Part 5, named after the Jimi Hendrix song.

name: King Crimson
explanation: King Crimson is Diavolo's time-erasing Stand in JoJo Part 5, named after the British prog rock band.

name: Gold Experience
explanation: Gold Experience is Giorno's life-giving Stand in JoJo Part 5, named after the Prince album.

name: Moody Blues
explanation: Moody Blues is Abbacchio's replay Stand in JoJo Part 5, named after the British rock band.

name: Whitesnake
explanation: Whitesnake is Pucci's disc-extracting Stand in JoJo Part 6, named after David Coverdale's rock band.

name: Weather Report
explanation: Weather Report is a weather-controlling Stand user in JoJo Part 6, named after the jazz fusion band.

name: Foo Fighters
explanation: Foo Fighters is a plankton colony Stand user in JoJo Part 6, named after Dave Grohl's rock band.

name: Oasis
explanation: Oasis is Secco's ground-softening Stand in JoJo Part 5, named after the British rock band.

name: Soft Machine
explanation: Soft Machine is Zucchero's deflating Stand in JoJo Part 5, named after the British rock band.

name: White Album
explanation: White Album is Ghiaccio's ice-armor Stand in JoJo Part 5, named after The Beatles' iconic 1968 album.

name: Tusk
explanation: Tusk is Johnny Joestar's spin-powered Stand in JoJo Part 7, named after the Fleetwood Mac album.

name: Scary Monsters
explanation: Scary Monsters is Diego Brando's dinosaur Stand in JoJo Part 7, named after the David Bowie album.

name: Highway to Hell
explanation: Highway to Hell is Thunder McQueen's suicide Stand in JoJo Part 6, named after the AC/DC album.

name: Bohemian Rhapsody
explanation: Bohemian Rhapsody is Ungalo's fiction-manifesting Stand in JoJo Part 6, named after Queen's legendary song.

name: Stone Free
explanation: Stone Free is Jolyne Cujoh's string-based Stand in JoJo Part 6, named after the Jimi Hendrix song.

name: REO Speedwagon
explanation: Robert E.O. Speedwagon is a beloved ally in JoJo Parts 1-2, named after the American rock band.

name: Crazy Diamond
explanation: Crazy Diamond is Josuke's restoration Stand in JoJo Part 4, named after the Pink Floyd song 'Shine On You Crazy Diamond'.

name: Killer Queen
explanation: Killer Queen is Kira's explosive Stand in JoJo Part 4, named after the Queen song.

name: The Hand
explanation: The Hand is Okuyasu's space-erasing Stand in JoJo Part 4, named after The Band, a rock group.

name: Cell
explanation: Cell is the bio-android villain in Dragon Ball Z, created from the cells of the strongest warriors.

name: Android
explanation: Androids 16, 17, 18 are cyborg warriors in DBZ, and Android is also Google's mobile operating system.

name: Fusion
explanation: Fusion is the DBZ technique where warriors merge, AMD's processor line, and the Ford Fusion sedan.

name: Vegeta
explanation: Vegeta is the Saiyan prince in DBZ, his name derived from 'vegetable'. All Saiyans are named after vegetables.

name: Kakarot
explanation: Kakarot is Goku's Saiyan birth name in DBZ, a pun on 'carrot'.

name: Frieza
explanation: Frieza is the tyrannical emperor in DBZ, his name a pun on 'freezer'.

name: Piccolo
explanation: Piccolo is the Namekian warrior in DBZ, named after the small flute instrument.

name: Trunks
explanation: Trunks is Vegeta's son in DBZ, named after underwear. The entire Briefs family is named after undergarments.

name: Krillin
explanation: Krillin is Goku's best friend in DBZ. His name comes from 'kuri' (chestnut in Japanese).

name: Gohan
explanation: Gohan is Goku's eldest son in DBZ. 'Gohan' means 'cooked rice' or 'meal' in Japanese.

name: Raditz
explanation: Raditz is Goku's evil brother in DBZ, his name derived from 'radish'.

name: Nappa
explanation: Nappa is Vegeta's bald henchman in DBZ, named after a Japanese term for leafy greens.

name: Broly
explanation: Broly is the Legendary Super Saiyan in DBZ movies, his name derived from 'broccoli'.

name: Shenron
explanation: Shenron is the wish-granting eternal dragon in Dragon Ball Z who grants wishes when summoned.

name: Majin
explanation: Majin is a title/race in Dragon Ball Z meaning 'demon person', most famously Majin Buu and Majin Vegeta.

name: Hit
explanation: Hit is the legendary assassin from Universe 6 in Dragon Ball Super, known for his Time-Skip technique.

name: Link
explanation: Link is the hero of the Legend of Zelda series, and a fundamental web/HTML concept.

name: Ganondorf
explanation: Ganondorf is the main antagonist of The Legend of Zelda series, the Gerudo King who wields the Triforce of Power.

name: Navi
explanation: Navi is Link's fairy companion in Ocarina of Time, and also an early AMD GPU architecture.

name: Epona
explanation: Epona is Link's horse in Zelda, named after the Celtic goddess of horses.

name: Hyrule
explanation: Hyrule is the kingdom where most Zelda games take place, home to the Triforce.

name: Triforce
explanation: The Triforce is the sacred golden relic in Zelda representing Power, Wisdom, and Courage.

name: Sheikah
explanation: The Sheikah are a mysterious ninja-like tribe in Zelda who created the Sheikah Slate.

name: Goron
explanation: Gorons are a rock-eating race in Zelda who live on Death Mountain.

name: Zora
explanation: Zora are an aquatic race in Zelda, including Princess Ruto and Prince Sidon.

name: Rito
explanation: Rito are a bird-like race in Zelda known for their archery skills.

name: Korok
explanation: Koroks are forest spirits in Zelda who evolved from the Kokiri.

name: Bokoblin
explanation: Bokoblins are pig-like enemies in The Legend of Zelda series, common foes in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lynel
explanation: Lynels are powerful centaur-lion enemies in The Legend of Zelda, among the toughest foes in Breath of the Wild.

name: Moblin
explanation: Moblins are bulldog-faced enemies in The Legend of Zelda, larger and stronger than Bokoblins.

name: Ocarina
explanation: The Ocarina of Time is a magical instrument in Zelda that controls time.

name: Master Sword
explanation: The Master Sword is the legendary Blade of Evil's Bane in The Legend of Zelda, wielded by Link.

name: Din
explanation: Din is the Goddess of Power in The Legend of Zelda, who created the red earth.

name: Farore
explanation: Farore is the Goddess of Courage in Zelda who created all life.

name: Nayru
explanation: Nayru is the Goddess of Wisdom in Zelda who created the laws of the world.

name: Revali
explanation: Revali is the arrogant Rito Champion in Breath of the Wild.

name: Urbosa
explanation: Urbosa is the Gerudo Champion in Breath of the Wild known for her lightning powers.

name: Daruk
explanation: Daruk is the Goron Champion in Breath of the Wild with a protective barrier ability.

name: Mipha
explanation: Mipha is the Zora Champion in Breath of the Wild with healing powers.

name: Exodia
explanation: Exodia the Forbidden One instantly wins the duel if all five pieces are in hand.

name: Blue-Eyes
explanation: Blue-Eyes White Dragon is Seto Kaiba's signature monster and one of the most iconic Yu-Gi-Oh! cards.

name: Dark Magician
explanation: Dark Magician is Yugi Muto's signature monster, one of the most iconic spellcaster cards in Yu-Gi-Oh!

name: Kuriboh
explanation: Kuriboh is a cute furball monster that can prevent battle damage.

name: Obelisk
explanation: Obelisk the Tormentor is an Egyptian God Card, and obelisks are real Egyptian monuments.

name: Slifer
explanation: Slifer the Sky Dragon is an Egyptian God Card named after a Yu-Gi-Oh! producer.

name: Ra
explanation: The Winged Dragon of Ra is an Egyptian God Card named after the Egyptian sun god.

name: Red-Eyes
explanation: Red-Eyes Black Dragon is Joey Wheeler's signature monster and rival to Blue-Eyes.

name: Elemental Hero
explanation: Elemental Heroes are Jaden Yuki's archetype of fusion-based superhero monsters.

name: Cyber Dragon
explanation: Cyber Dragon is a machine-type monster central to the Cyber archetype in Yu-Gi-Oh!

name: Stardust Dragon
explanation: Stardust Dragon is Yusei Fudo's ace Synchro Monster from 5D's.

name: Number 39
explanation: Number 39: Utopia is Yuma's ace Xyz Monster in Yu-Gi-Oh! Zexal, a key card in his Number hunting.

name: Pot of Greed
explanation: Pot of Greed draws two cards - so powerful it's been banned for years.

name: Mirror Force
explanation: Mirror Force destroys all attacking monsters when activated.

name: Mystical Space Typhoon
explanation: Mystical Space Typhoon (MST) destroys spell/trap cards and is a staple card.

name: Monster Reborn
explanation: Monster Reborn is one of the most powerful spell cards, reviving any monster from either graveyard.

name: Greymon
explanation: Greymon is Agumon's Champion form, a dinosaur Digimon breathing fire.

name: Agumon
explanation: Agumon is the partner Digimon of Tai in Digimon Adventure, a small dinosaur.

name: Gabumon
explanation: Gabumon is Matt's partner Digimon, a reptile wearing a wolf pelt.

name: Patamon
explanation: Patamon is T.K.'s partner Digimon, a winged hamster-like creature.

name: Gatomon
explanation: Gatomon is Kari's cat-like Champion Digimon who can digivolve to Angewomon.

name: Angemon
explanation: Angemon is Patamon's angelic Champion form in Digimon Adventure, known for defeating Devimon.

name: Angewomon
explanation: Angewomon is Gatomon's Ultimate form in Digimon Adventure, an angelic archer Digimon.

name: Devimon
explanation: Devimon is a fallen angel Digimon and the first major villain in Digimon Adventure.

name: Beelzemon
explanation: Beelzemon is Impmon's Mega form in Digimon Tamers, a demon lord Digimon inspired by Beelzebub.

name: Omnimon
explanation: Omnimon is the DNA Digivolution of WarGreymon and MetalGarurumon.

name: Wargreymon
explanation: WarGreymon is Agumon's Mega form, wielding the Dramon Destroyers.

name: MetalGarurumon
explanation: MetalGarurumon is Gabumon's Mega form, a cybernetic wolf with missiles.

name: Leomon
explanation: Leomon is a noble lion warrior Digimon known for dying in every series.

name: Myotismon
explanation: Myotismon is a vampire Digimon and major villain in Digimon Adventure.

name: Piedmon
explanation: Piedmon is a clown-like Dark Master Digimon who turns enemies into keychains.

name: Machinedramon
explanation: Machinedramon is a Dark Master in Digimon Adventure, one of the most powerful machine Digimon.

name: Metalseadramon
explanation: MetalSeadramon is a Dark Master, a giant sea serpent covered in Chrome Digizoid.

name: Puppetmon
explanation: Puppetmon is a Dark Master made of wood who controls others like puppets.

name: Imperialdramon
explanation: Imperialdramon is the DNA Digivolution of Veemon and Wormmon's Mega forms.

name: Alphamon
explanation: Alphamon is a Royal Knight Digimon who leads the Royal Knights.

name: Buu
explanation: Majin Buu is the ancient pink magical being in Dragon Ball Z who absorbs enemies and can turn people into candy.

name: Beerus
explanation: Beerus is the God of Destruction in Dragon Ball Super, a cat-like deity who can erase anything.

name: Whis
explanation: Whis is Beerus's angelic attendant in Dragon Ball Super, able to rewind time.

name: Zeno
explanation: Zeno is the Omni-King in Dragon Ball Super. Zeno of Citium founded Stoicism; Zeno of Elea created famous paradoxes.

name: Jinzo
explanation: Jinzo is an android monster famous for negating all trap cards while on the field.

name: Sangan
explanation: Sangan is a three-eyed fiend that searches for weak monsters when destroyed.

name: Marshmallon
explanation: Marshmallon is an indestructible fairy monster that looks like a cute blob.

name: Summoned Skull
explanation: Summoned Skull is a classic fiend-type monster and one of the original powerful beatsticks in Yu-Gi-Oh!
